verb.description: To query; to question. Frequently with whether.

exclamation.description: Introducing a question or subject of enquiry: ask, inquire, query; one may ask, it is a question (whether, etc.).

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in William Sclater. From quaere. Compare earlier quaere, queer<br>mid 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Phaer (?1510–1560), translator and physician. From classical Latin quaere, imperative singular of quaerere (in post-classical Latin also querere) to ask, inquire. For later spellings of the word see query and discussion at that entry. Perhaps compare also quary.
